findings.title: Potential inconsistent state after parameter reset
findings.description: The CakeRush contract distributes rewards according to several parameters. However, these functions only reset the parameters, but not the user information stored in the userInfos state variable.

findings.title: Repeated claim of mCake rewards
findings.description: The claim function contains an issue that allows users to claim mCake rewards multiple times due to incorrect implementation of reward claim logic.

findings.title: Check the parameters in initialization functions
findings.description: In the initialization functions of the CakeRush and PancakeStakingBNBChain contracts, there are parameters that cannot be changed after initialization. It is recommended that these parameters should be checked in the initialization functions.

findings.title: Check the parameters in CakeRush contracts
findings.description: In the CakeRush contract, several parameters regarding the reward distribution can be added, but there is no check that these parameters are set correctly according to the assumptions in the contract.

findings.title: Extra conditions in modifiers
findings.description: Remove extraneous conditions in the modifier.

findings.title: Potential centralization risk
findings.description: The owner of CakeRush holds significant privileges to modify critical configurations, creating a single point of failure. If an attacker were to compromise the owner, they could potentially incapacitate the entire system.
